title: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow - Mirror Fate HD
notes: Fullscreen doesn't work

title: DOOM
notes: Runs good with in vulkan (did not test opengl).

title: DOOM
notes: On Arch based distros you need to run the game via Steam (Runtime), and set "+r_renderapi 1" as a launch option to launch the game in Vulkan. It does not work in OpenGL mode.

title: DOOM
notes: Framerate Spikes but otherwise stable

title: DOOM
notes: Vulkan version works @60FPS, OpenGL @50FPS

title: DOOM
notes: No audio. Other games, even those running through wine, do have audio. Tested audio in the wine-prefix using winetricks, but withing winecfg there was audio. Must go wrong somewhere on the interaction level because the audio never makes it from the game to PulseAudio.

title: DOOM
notes: +r_renderAPI 1 must be added to launch options

title: DOOM
notes: Vertical Sync on 144Hz Monitor works - use full screen instead of fullscreen windowed for best performance and graphics.

title: DOOM
notes: The performance is solid, well over 100fps at all time. The game initially did refuse to start due to it trying to run in OpenGL, adding "+r_renderapi=1" to the game launch option resolved that issue. I experienced a single random crash once about 15 minutes in to the game, I have not experienced it in several hours of play since.

title: DOOM
notes: Almost 100% of windows performance. Flawless.

notes: Set launch options to +r_renderapi 1, if the screen is still black wait like five minutes. Alt-tabbing caused a crash.

title: DOOM
notes: Works with OpenGL only with Mesa-git 18.3.0, will not launch otherwise. Using Vulkan API gives the error "VK_ERROR_FEATURE_NOT_PRESENT".

title: DOOM
notes: Previously black screen (vulkan version), now works perfectly since latest steam update. Note that save files were corrupt, but I located the old save from Windows partition and copied in some missing .verify files. Resuming save dropped me in an empty room, but restarting the mission put me back where I should be.

title: DOOM
notes: Refused to start at first, but worked after retrying a couple times. Only crashed once during a cutscene, performance seems to not be affected noticeably

title: DOOM
notes: Noticeable mouse lag, Vulkan renderer required renaming of intel files in /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/

title: DOOM
notes: Steam does not switch controller configs. Game uses controller icons even when mouse and keyboard are used. Steam Overlay does not work. Otherwise works flawlessly.

title: DOOM
notes:
Game automatically exits on launching, and then starts syncing. No error Message is given, no error log is produced. 
Running with and without Vulkan flag render_api = 1.

title: DOOM
notes: An update to wine/proton has broken Doom 2016 since August 23 2018, resulting in a black screen on startup. Workaround is to wintricks xinput: see https://bit.ly/2BWnqTp

title: DOOM
notes: Just tested a few minutes. works out of the box (without startup parameters).

title: DOOM
notes: Works almost flawlessly.

title: DOOM
notes: Library > right-click DOOM > Properties > Set Launch Options: +r_renderapi 1

title: DOOM
notes: OpenGL backend crashes on startup, but Vulkan (add +r_renderapi 1 to launch options) is completely stable

title: DOOM
notes: Cannot run .cfg.

title: DOOM
notes: Game starts with OpenGL renderer, which works perfectly. Once renderer is changed to Vulkan, all textures are black - but this is confirmed issue with NVIDIA drivers: https://forums.geforce.com/default/topic/1068996/-bug-vulkan-api-for-doom-2016-causes-almost-all-models-and-textures-to-be-black-on-newest-drivers/?offset=3

title: DOOM
notes: Single Player / Campaign works fine with forced Vulkan renderer (+ r_renderAPI 1), Multiplayer crashes immediately after match transitions from lobby to the actual game. Performance-wise, looks like it's on par with Windows.

title: DOOM
notes: Crashes immediately with OpenGL.  Will start with Vulkan (+r_renderapi 1 in launch options) but then freezes after intro videos with 99% loading indicated.

title: DOOM
notes: Game will slow to a crawl periodically, which can only be fixed by quitting to desktop. Seems to be related to mouse movement somehow.

notes: Performance are great and it works out of box,  faster loading then on Windows same box video: https://twitter.com/0xUID/status/1033428426760314880

title: DOOM

title: DOOM
notes:
At start, i have only a black screen. I've try some +cmd I've found all around: no way, black screen, cpu 100%. At last, i've found a trick: install xinput.dll. Try this: WINEPREFIX=/path to your steamlibrary/SteamLibrary/steamapps/compatdata/379720/pfx winetricks
and then install xinput.dll
After this, game started regularry and works wery well.

title: DOOM
notes: Flawless and good performance with Vulkan, with OpenGL at full-screen video was flickering.

title: DOOM
notes: Steam saves work, graphics look great, no crashes.

title: DOOM
notes: Small visual glitches in the background in-menu. Does not affect gameplay or the ability to use the menu. Performance is solid when using Vulkan.

notes: Singleplayer performance is great and near identical to performance on Windows. title: DOOM

notes: Runs almost in same parity as the windows version. There are some areas where the framerate drops to ~20 FPS, but these are just because of shader compilation (I think). If you remain in this area for a couple of minutes, the framerate goes back up to 60 FPS. This is a one time task, so there should be no problems on subsequent playthroughs.

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: needs steam runtime, had crackly audio until i enabled tsched and avoid-resampling + set default sample rate to 48000 in pulseaudio, crashes/black screen if it loses focus (alt tab etc), runs in opengl by default requiring startup arg to run in vulkan
title: DOOM

notes: Needs to be launched with "+r_renderAPI 1" and doesn't like losing focus (crashes on alt+tab). Otherwise, runs perfectly at a constant 75 fps @ 1440p on the highest settings.
title: DOOM

notes: Had some issues with razer chroma which killed performance. Replaced CChromaLibaryEditor.dll with this: https://github.com/Riesi/CChromaEditor/releases/tag/EMPTY1.0
title: DOOM

notes:
Seems to work perfectly.  I am running Kubuntu 18.04,  on
an older 8-core AMD FX-8350, with a MSI GTX 1080 Ti.  The game averages 60 fps and the video is very smooth.  Overall I can't even tell it's not a native Linux game.
title: DOOM

notes:
Only works with the Steam runtime, Steam "native" crashes with "default.cfg" error (can't write initial config due to permission errors?). 

At 1080p, I get a solid 60+ fps with all settings maxed out, out-of-the-box with no changes other than the Steam runtime.  When running, gameplay is incredibly smooth, no hiccups or stuttering, and my XBox One controller (wired) is picked up automatically.  

Running with Vulkan causes seemingly random crashes to both the game and to Steam (unclear if the game crashing causes Steam to also crash or vice versa).  This also corrupts the save file as a result.

Running with OpenGL seems more stable (no crashes yet) but causes a slightly higher load on the hardware.
title: DOOM

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes:
Works perfectly with launch option: "+r_renderapi 1" (force use Vulkan)
Performance: 50-60+ FPS, with Ultra preset, in 4k resolution (3840 x 2160).
Multiplayer: Does not work; finding a game causes a crash. Private game, without match making, was not tested. This is the reason for the Silver rating.
Snap Map Mode: Works without issues. Multiplayer/Co-Op untested.

notes: Works out of the box. OpenGL Perfomance mostly 70-90 fps, Vulkan goes up to ~110 with gfx settings on "high". Initial loading even faster than native Windows 7 for some reason.

notes: 30-40 fps using OpenGL and 50-60fps using Vulkan, on my abysmal toaster. This game pulls off absolute wizardry
